Title
Computer Scientist (Computer Vision), Vision Systems Group

15-Oct-2018

Job Description
SRI International’s Center for Vision Technologies offers end-to-end computer vision solutions that translate into real-world applications. Our scientists have pioneered real-time, real-world systems in multimodal (text, audio, and vision) analytics, stereo processing, 3D scene understanding, object recognition, activity recognition and integrated sensor and processing solutions. We continue today to advance real-time computer vision algorithms directly applicable into real-world applications.

We are looking for a creative and energetic research scientist with a strong academic and practical background in computer vision algorithms including image enhancement, computation imaging, stereo, semantic reasoning and activity recognition algorithms. A successful candidate needs to demonstrate the ability to conduct state-of-the-art research, preferably in the area of real-time computer vision algorithms development and implementation on commercial processing hardware. You will develop end-to-end systems in applications for imaging, vision and other sensing domains. The right candidate will possess a strong technical background and software development, understanding methods for working across different program teams. You must be able to thrive and succeed in a fast-paced research environment. Maturity, innovation, design judgment and the ability to be a team player are essential to succeed in this role.

Responsibilities include:
  • Support computer vision algorithm design, implementation and testing. Support operational prototype developments and investigate their deployment in real world operations.
  • Support the development of exploring novel solutions in the area of computer vision, computational sensing, sematic reasoning, and related areas.
  • Support development of software for PC, smartphones, FPGAs, and GPUs.
  • Develop software under robust and agile methods, including design, documentation and revision control practices.
  • Support development of new IP within government, commercial, and internally funded programs.
